properties.description: On Feb. 1, a University Police Department officer met with a complainant who reported that his cell phone was stolen from his dressing room at the University Theater Center.

On Feb. 2, while conducting a traffice stop, a UPD officer determined that the driver, a resident of Sugar Land, Texas, was intoxicated. The driver was arrested and charged with Driving While Intoxicated.

On Feb. 2, an officer was dispatched to the student residence, Bearkat Village, in reference to a single vehicle accident. Upon arrival, the officer observed that a car had traveled over a retaining wall and struck several air conditioning units. A motor vehicle crash report was completed.
On Feb. 2, an officer responded to the food court in the Lowman Student Center, the Paw Print, to assist with a medical call.

On Feb. 2, UPD was dispatched to the Jolly Fox night club in reference to a reported assault. Upon arrival, an officer observed an individual who was arguing with Jolly Fox management. Once the suspect observed the officer, he ran back inside the building. The officer located the suspect, a university student, who was highly intoxicated. He was arrested and charged with Public Intoxication.
On Feb. 3, an officer was dispatched Health and Kineseology center where the complainant reported that his cell phone was stolen while left in an unsecured cubby hole near the basketball courts.

On Feb. 4, an officer was dispatched to the Zeta Tau Alpha House, in reference to a dispute. Upon arrival, the officer met with Residence Life staff and ZTA residents in reference to a complaint about Residence Life policies in regard to males in the residence hall area. Information was obtained and will be forwarded to Residence Life.
On Feb. 4, officers helped the Huntsville Police Department with a combative man. The man was taken into custody by HPD and charged with resisting arrest and public intoxication.

On Feb. 4, an officer observed a vehicle strike another legally parked vehicle. The officer, while out of the patrol car, shined his flashlight at the driver and instructed him to stay on the scene. The driver, while looking at the officer, rolled up his window and fled the scene. The officer then engaged in a pursuit of the suspect vehicle. The driver was identified as a university student. The driver was arrested and charged with disregarding a stop sign and duty upon striking a parked vehicle.

On Feb. 6, an officer was dispatched to the Barrett House in reference to a welfare concern report. Upon arrival, officers met with the Residence Life staff and the student in question. The student was then transported by ambulance to Huntsville Memorial Hospital for further treatment.

On Feb. 6, an officer was dispatched to Raven Village in reference to a reported alcohol violation. Upon arrival, officer determined that four minors were in possession of alcohol (one female student, two female non-students and one male non-student.) All four individuals were cited for the offense of Minor in Possession of Alcohol and released.
On Feb. 7, an officer was dispatched to Bowers Boulevard where the complainant stated he backed a university vehicle in a metal light pole.

On Feb. 8, the Raven Village Residence Life staff reproted a damaged residence to UPD. Upon inspection, an officer noted damage to the door and walls in the room. The occupants of the room were interviewed, and an incident report was completed and fowarded to both Residence Life and the Dean of Students' Office.

On Feb. 8, a complainant at the University Hotel reported to UPD that their vehicle was damaged while legally parked in the parking area. A second vehicle was identified, and the owners exchanged information.

On Feb. 8, a complainant reported that their vehicle was damaged while legally parked in the university parking area. Upon inspection, a UPD officer found that the vehicle had been "keyed" on the passanger side.

On Feb. 9, officer met with a complaintant who reported that while driving her vehicle in a university parking lot, she was struck by another vehicle. This vehicle drove off without providing any information. The victim was able to provide a suspect description and a license plate number of the suspect vehicle. An investigation continues.

On Feb. 9, the University Book Store staff reported that a male stole a textbook from the store and fled. During the investigation, the male was identified as a university student. An investigation continues.

On Feb. 9, a student reported to UPD that a former member of his organization was removing approved organizational fliers from different campus locations. An incident report was completed and sent to the Dean of Students' office for review.

On Feb. 11, UPD was dispatched to the Bearkat Village residence hall in reference to a missing student. A complainant reported that the male student was missing and there were suspicious circumstances surrounding the incident. The missing student in question was located a short time later, and information about this incident will be forwarded to the Dean of Students' Office for review.
On Feb. 11, a complaintant reported her iPhone was stolen from a classroom in Academic Building I. An investigation continues.

On Feb. 11, an officer conducted a pedestrian stop and identified a male Huntsville resident who was highly intoxicated. The man was arrested and charged with Public Intoxication. While at walker County Jail, the male was found in possession of contraband. The male was susequently charged with Possession of Child Pornography.

On Feb. 11, while conducting a traffic stop, an officer determined that a university student driver was in possession of contraband. The driver was arrested and charged with Possession of Marijuana and Possession of Drug Paraphernalia.

On Feb. 12, while conducting a traffic stop, an officer found a male resident of Magnolia, Texas, was intoxicated. The driver was arrested and charged with Driving While Intoxicated and Driving While License Suspended. A female passanger was also arrested and charged with Public Intoxication.

On Feb. 13, a UPD officer stopped a suspicious male in the museum grounds. The officer found the Huntsville male's behaviour to be disruptive, and he was issued a criminal trespass warning for SHSU property.
On Feb. 14, officer met with a student complaintant who reported that she was assualted by a faculty member. An investigation continues.
On Feb. 14, an officer investigated a traffice accident involving a university owned vehicle.
On Feb. 14, a university staff member reported fraudulent transactions on a department credit card used for purchasing.

On Feb. 14, while conducting a traffic stop in the 2100 block of Sam Houston Avenue, an officer determined that the driver, a male resident of Huntsville, Texas, was intoxicated. The driver was arrested and charged with Driving While Intoxicated.

On Feb. 14, an officer was dispatched to the Crawford House in reference to a suspicious odor. Upon arrival, officer determined that the two male students who resided in the residence were in possession of contraband. One of the male students was arrested and charged with Possession of Drug Paraphernalia and Minor in Possession of Alcohol.  The other male student was arrested and charged with Possession of Marijuana and Possession of Drug Paraphernalia.
